title: Grammar recap
description:
Alle grammatica onderwerpen kort uitgelegd met oefeningen. 
Te gebruiken voor differentiate en om studenten zelf alles terug te laten vinden.

license.name: CC Naamsvermelding 4.0 Internationale licentie

items.content:
Habits: I eat pancakes every morning.

Regularities: I usually go to the gym on Sundays.

Facts: Class starts at 8:30 A.M.

I (ik-vorm): stam van het werkwoord

He/ she/ it: stam + s

We/ you/ they: stam van het werkwoord
Example: I like singing.

We or I? Use don't

He/ she/ it? Use doesn't

Keep in mind! He/ she/ it but negative? No added 's'
Example: I don't like football.

I/ we/ they? Use do

He/ she/ it? Use does

Place do or does at the front of the sentence.

Keep in mind! He/ she/ it but in a question? No added 's'
Example: Does she like chocolate?

content.body: Every Friday indicates it is a habit.

Every Friday indicates it is a habit.
He/ she/ it? Add 's'
Every evening indicates it's a habit.
Every evening indicates it's a habit.

They: use do.
Put do in the front of the sentence.

They: use do.
​Put do in the front of the sentence.

She: use does.
Put does at the front of the sentence.

She: use does.
Put does at the front of the sentence.

items.content: When something happens now and it hasn't ended yet.
Use a form of to be + stam van het werkwoord + ing
Example: I am eating a sandwich right now.
Use not in the sentence.
Example: I am not enjoying school.
Switch the place of the subject en the form of to be
Example: Are we going to the supermarket?

When an action is started in the past and still going on.

Tip: it often includes one of the words for and since
Use a form of 'to have' + stam + ed / 3e rijtje irregular verbs
Example: I have worked at this school for half a year.
Add into the sentence.
Example: She has not done her homework.
Switch around the form of to have and the subject.
Example: Have we lived here since I was born?

content.body: I English for three years so I'll be done next year. (studying)

items.content:
-When we prefer not to mention who or what does the action (for example, it's not known, it's obvious or we don't want to say).

-So that we can start a sentence with the most important or most logical information.

-In more formal or scientific writing.

Subject + form of 'to be' + past participle

Look at what tense the original sentence is. Use the correct form of 'to be'.

You don't always have to mention who completed the action.

Only mention it when it adds to the sentence

heading.content: Let's practice. Turn these active sentences into passive sentences:

values.value: This house was built by my grandfather in 1943.

content.body: This house was built by my grandfather in 1943.

values.value: The classroom has been cleaned (by the cleaner).​

content.body: The classroom has been cleaned (by the cleaner).​

values.value: The presents have been bought by my mother. ​

content.body: The presents have been bought by my mother. ​

items.content: To talk about habits, regularities or facts.
Stam van het werkwoord +ed/ 2e rijtje irregular verbs
Example: He went to school yesterday

Use did not + stam van het werkwoord

Don't use the past form of the verb because did is already a past form.
Example: I didn't work at the supermarket.

Use did + onderwerp + stam van het werkwoord.

Let op! Did is negative so stam is positive.
Example: Did you see Bokito in Blijdorp?

content.body: she nice dinner last night? (cooking, question)

items.content: When something happened in the past and when it was happening for a period of time.

Use was/ were + stam + ing

I/ he/ she/ it= was

You/ we/ they= were
Example: I was listening to music during class.
Was/ were +not + stam + ing
Example: We were not paying attention during class.
Was/ were + subject + stam + ing
Example: Were you cooking when she called?

content.body: I for my exam when my phone rang. (studying)
They TV when the power went out. (watching)
He sick, so he was lying in bed all day. (feeling)
He attention when his boss was giving instructions. (paying, negative)
They when she sang of key. (listening, negative)
the kids outside when you got home from work? (playing, question)

items.content: To show that one event happened before the other event.
Use had + stam +ed/ 3e rijtje irregular verbs
Add 'not'
Example: I hadn't/ had not used the telephone.
Put 'had' in front of the rest of the sentence.
Example: Had he bought something, before he stole that dress?

content.body: By the time I arrived at the party, everyone already . (leaving)
He never sushi before he went to Japan. (trying)
The company a new CEO before the old one retired. (hiring)
I all my homework before I went to bed. (finishing)
By the time the movie started, the theater already up. (filling)
He his keys, so he had to break into his own apartment. (forgetting)
She enough money to buy a car before she graduated from college. (saving)
